Please save the date for these two informative and exciting events sponsored by NAHS.

On Monday, September 21st at 5:30 p.m., we will have a virtual Senior Parent Night hosted by Get2College. This will be a refresher from the Junior Parent Night that took place in the spring. At Senior Parent Night, parents and students will learn about the importance of weighing college options, how to pay for college, and more to get seniors ready for life after high school!

The College/Career Fair will start at 6:30 p.m. after Senior Parent Night for students in grades 9-12. College admissions counselors and military recruiters will be available virtually to meet with students during this time.

We look forward to these two events and hope to "see" you all there! More information will be available soon!

Official Statement from Dr. Lance Evans, Superintendent

We are currently monitoring the situation regarding the COVID-19 virus. Our administrative team and our school board want to ensure that the health and safety of our students and staff remain a top priority during this time. Using guidance from the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention, we have had a plan in place for several weeks regarding cleaning and disinfecting, as well as educational awareness. We will consistently seek guidance from and follow the direction of the Mississippi Department of Education, the Mississippi High School Activities Association, and the Mississippi Department of Health. In addition, we will be in close contact with our local medical community for advisement. We will continue to make updates and post any important announcements on our social media outlets throughout the weekend.

“The New Albany School District is a place where teachers and students are supported by servant leaders in a positive school culture. The opportunities for teacher growth and student success are fostered by the high expectations of our “A” rated school district. Through the 1:1 initiative with Apple, teaching and learning are taking place in ways that were not possible before the implementation of the iPad. I am thankful to work in a forward-thinking school district, which is supported by our community.”

Kimberly Langley
New Albany Career & Technical Center
